headline: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Faces Hurdles: 'It's A Lot Of Market Share'
summary: President Donald Trump said Sunday night that the proposed Netflix-Warner Bros. deal could be a problem. "It’s a lot of market share."

content.title: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal Faces Hurdles: 'It's A Lot Of Market Share'
content.summary: President Donald Trump said Sunday night that the proposed Netflix-Warner Bros. deal could be a problem. "It’s a lot of market share."

headline: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Deal ‘Could be a Problem’
summary: WASHINGTON—President Trump said  Netflix’s   $72 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. “could be a problem” because it would result in a large market share for the streaming giant, signaling possible government resistance in his first public comments about the sale.  “They have a very big market share,” Trump said Sunday night of Netflix.  “And when they have Warner Brothers, that share goes up a lot.”

content.title: Trump Says Netflix-Warner Deal ‘Could be a Problem’
content.summary: WASHINGTON—President Trump said  Netflix’s   $72 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. “could be a problem” because it would result in a large market share for the streaming giant, signaling possible government resistance in his first public comments about the sale.  “They have a very big market share,” Trump said Sunday night of Netflix.  “And when they have Warner Brothers, that share goes up a lot.”

headline: Paramount makes $108.4 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery
summary: Dec 8 () - Paramount Skydance on Monday launched a hostile bid worth $108.4 billion for Warner Bros Discovery, throwing a wrench into the deal with Netflix in a last-ditch effort to create a media powerhouse ​that would challenge the dominance of the streaming giant.

content.title: Paramount makes $108.4 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery
content.summary: Dec 8 () - Paramount Skydance on Monday launched a hostile bid worth $108.4 billion for Warner Bros Discovery, throwing a wrench into the deal with Netflix in a last-ditch effort to create a media powerhouse ​that would challenge the dominance of the streaming giant.

headline: PARAMOUNT LAUNCHES All-CASH TENDER OFFER TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY FOR $30 PER SHARE
summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today announced it has commenced an all-cash tender offer to acquire all of the outstanding shares of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") for $30.00 per share in cash. Paramount's proposed transaction is for the entirety of WBD, including the Global Networks segment.

content.title: PARAMOUNT LAUNCHES All-CASH TENDER OFFER TO ACQUIRE WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY FOR $30 PER SHARE
content.summary: Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount"), today announced it has commenced an all-cash tender offer to acquire all of the outstanding shares of Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") for $30.00 per share in cash. Paramount's proposed transaction is for the entirety of WBD, including the Global Networks segment.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps After Paramount Makes Bid
summary: Shares in Warner Bros. Discovery jumped after Paramount said it was launching an all-cash tender offer for the media company, attempting to derail a $72 billion deal with Netflix.  Warner Discovery shares rose more 7% in morning trading, to more than $28 a share.  Paramount is offering $30 a share.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps After Paramount Makes Bid
content.summary: Shares in Warner Bros. Discovery jumped after Paramount said it was launching an all-cash tender offer for the media company, attempting to derail a $72 billion deal with Netflix.  Warner Discovery shares rose more 7% in morning trading, to more than $28 a share.  Paramount is offering $30 a share.

headline: Paramount Makes Hostile Takeover Bid for Warner After Netflix Struck Deal
summary: Paramount launched a hostile takeover offer for Warner Bros. Discovery, taking its case for acquiring the company directly to shareholders just days after Warner agreed to a deal with Netflix.

content.title: Paramount Makes Hostile Takeover Bid for Warner After Netflix Struck Deal
content.summary: Paramount launched a hostile takeover offer for Warner Bros. Discovery, taking its case for acquiring the company directly to shareholders just days after Warner agreed to a deal with Netflix.

headline: Paramount goes hostile in bid for Warner Bros., challenging a $72 billion bid by Netflix
summary: Paramount has gone hostile in its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, challenging Netflix which reached a $72 billion takeover deal with the company just days ago.  Paramount said Monday that it is going straight to Warner Bros. shareholders with a bid worth about $74.4 billion, or $30 per share in cash.  Paramount, unlike Netflix, is also offering to buy the cable assets of Warner Bros., and asking shareholders of the company to reject the Netflix bid.

content.title: Paramount goes hostile in bid for Warner Bros., challenging a $72 billion bid by Netflix
content.summary: Paramount has gone hostile in its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, challenging Netflix which reached a $72 billion takeover deal with the company just days ago.  Paramount said Monday that it is going straight to Warner Bros. shareholders with a bid worth about $74.4 billion, or $30 per share in cash.  Paramount, unlike Netflix, is also offering to buy the cable assets of Warner Bros., and asking shareholders of the company to reject the Netflix bid.

thumbnail.caption: The Warner Bros. water tower is seen at Warner Bros. Studios in Burbank, Calif., Friday, Dec. 5, 2025. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong)

headline: Paramount launches hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros
summary: Paramount has launched a $108.4bn (£81bn) hostile bid for Warner Bros, challenging Netflix, which had reached a $72bn (£54bn) takeover deal with the company.  Paramount said on Monday that it was going straight to Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) shareholders with a $30 (£22.50) per share in cash offer for the entirety of the company, including its Global Networks segment, asking them to reject the deal with Netflix.

content.title: Paramount launches hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros
content.summary: Paramount has launched a $108.4bn (£81bn) hostile bid for Warner Bros, challenging Netflix, which had reached a $72bn (£54bn) takeover deal with the company.  Paramount said on Monday that it was going straight to Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) shareholders with a $30 (£22.50) per share in cash offer for the entirety of the company, including its Global Networks segment, asking them to reject the deal with Netflix.

headline: Wall Street hangs near its records as the battle to buy Warner Bros. heats up
summary: U.S. stocks are hanging at the edge of their record heights on Monday as Wall Street waits to hear from the Federal Reserve later this week on what it will do with interest rates.  Most stocks were falling, but Warner Bros. Discovery rallied 7.8% after Paramount took its offer to buy the entertainment giant directly to shareholders.  Paramount said it’s offering $30 in cash for each Warner Bros. Discovery share, as well as a quicker and easier way for investors to get their payout.

content.title: Wall Street hangs near its records as the battle to buy Warner Bros. heats up
content.summary: U.S. stocks are hanging at the edge of their record heights on Monday as Wall Street waits to hear from the Federal Reserve later this week on what it will do with interest rates.  Most stocks were falling, but Warner Bros. Discovery rallied 7.8% after Paramount took its offer to buy the entertainment giant directly to shareholders.  Paramount said it’s offering $30 in cash for each Warner Bros. Discovery share, as well as a quicker and easier way for investors to get their payout.

thumbnail.caption: Trader Edward Curran works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, Monday, Nov. 24, 2025. (AP Photo/Richard Drew)

headline: Paramount Skydance makes hostile bif doe WBD, Berkshire's top stock picker to exit
summary: Morning Brief Anchor Julie Hyman reports on the biggest news of the day for Monday, December 8, 2025.  Julie reports the breaking news on Paramount Skydance (PSKY) making a hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). She and her guests also discuss Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK-B, BRK-A) top stock picker, Todd Combs, leaving for JPMorgan, and IBM's (IBM) announcement that it is acquiring Confluent (CFLT) in an $11 billion deal. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Paramount Skydance makes hostile bif doe WBD, Berkshire's top stock picker to exit
content.description:
Morning Brief Anchor Julie Hyman reports on the biggest news of the day for Monday, December 8, 2025. 

Julie reports the breaking news on Paramount Skydance (PSKY) making a hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). She and her guests also discuss Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK-B, BRK-A) top stock picker, Todd Combs, leaving for JPMorgan, and IBM's (IBM) announcement that it is acquiring Confluent (CFLT) in an $11 billion deal.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Morning Brief Anchor Julie Hyman reports on the biggest news of the day for Monday, December 8, 2025.  Julie reports the breaking news on Paramount Skydance (PSKY) making a hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). She and her guests also discuss Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK-B, BRK-A) top stock picker, Todd Combs, leaving for JPMorgan, and IBM's (IBM) announcement that it is acquiring Confluent (CFLT) in an $11 billion deal. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Comcast’s Warner Bros. Bid Was ‘Light’ on Cash, Co-CEO Says
summary: Comcast’s bid for the studio and streaming assets of Warner Bros. Discovery was “light [on cash] relative to the other proposals” from Netflix and Paramount, Comcast co-CEO Mike Cavanagh said at a UBS investor conference Monday.  Comcast, whose shares were off about 1% in Monday trading, was one of three media companies that bid for the assets.  Netflix agreed on Friday to acquire Warner’s studios and HBO Max streaming business for $72 billion, though on Monday morning Paramount launched a hostile all-cash offer for the full Warner Bros. Discovery company, including its cable networks.

content.title: Comcast’s Warner Bros. Bid Was ‘Light’ on Cash, Co-CEO Says
content.summary: Comcast’s bid for the studio and streaming assets of Warner Bros. Discovery was “light [on cash] relative to the other proposals” from Netflix and Paramount, Comcast co-CEO Mike Cavanagh said at a UBS investor conference Monday.  Comcast, whose shares were off about 1% in Monday trading, was one of three media companies that bid for the assets.  Netflix agreed on Friday to acquire Warner’s studios and HBO Max streaming business for $72 billion, though on Monday morning Paramount launched a hostile all-cash offer for the full Warner Bros. Discovery company, including its cable networks.

Netflix  on Friday agreed to buy Warner Bros. for $72 billion after Warner splits its studios and HBO Max streaming business from its cable networks.

content.title: Paramount Made a Hostile Bid for Warner After Netflix Deal. What Happens Next?
content.summary: Paramount on Monday made a $77.9 billion hostile takeover bid for  Warner Bros. Discovery  escalating its fight for the entertainment company against Netflix by bringing its case directly to Warner shareholders.  Netflix  on Friday agreed to buy Warner Bros. for $72 billion after Warner splits its studios and HBO Max streaming business from its cable networks.

headline: NFLX- Warner Buy Will Leave it With an $82.7 Billion Headache
summary: Netflix Inc. (NFLX) just bought an $82.7 billion headache. It dropped that much money to swallow Warner Bros. Studios and HBO Max through a buyout of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (WBD) — snapping up Harry Potter, Batman, Game of Thrones, and Casablanca like it was clearing out the bargain bin at a liquidation sale, suggests Keith Fitz-Gerald, editor of 5 With Fitz.

headline: Why Trump says Netflix–Warner Bros. deal could be a 'problem'
summary: Paramount Skydance (PSKY) offered an all-cash bid for Warner Bros. (WBD), countering WBD's recently announced deal with Netflix (NFLX). Paramount's offer comes after US President Trump told reporters that the Netflix deal could be a "problem" given the streaming giant's market share dominance. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to outline the details of Paramount's offer compared to Netflix's. Innovator Capital Management chief investment strategist Tim Urbanowicz discusses what the bidding war means for Netflix investors and consumer prices. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Why Trump says Netflix–Warner Bros. deal could be a 'problem'
content.description:
Paramount Skydance (PSKY) offered an all-cash bid for Warner Bros. (WBD), countering WBD's recently announced deal with Netflix (NFLX). Paramount's offer comes after US President Trump told reporters that the Netflix deal could be a "problem" given the streaming giant's market share dominance.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to outline the details of Paramount's offer compared to Netflix's. Innovator Capital Management chief investment strategist Tim Urbanowicz discusses what the bidding war means for Netflix investors and consumer prices.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Paramount's offer comes after US President Trump told reporters that the Netflix deal could be a "problem" given the streaming giant's market share dominance. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to outline the details of Paramount's offer compared to Netflix's. Innovator Capital Management chief investment strategist Tim Urbanowicz discusses what the bidding war means for Netflix investors and consumer prices.
